benchmark_details.name: JDocQA (Japanese Document Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: JDocQA is a large-scale document-based QA dataset, requiring both visual and textual information to answer questions. It comprises 5,504 documents in PDF format and 11,600 annotated question-and-answer instances in Japanese.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for generative language models to effectively perform question answering on Japanese documents incorporating both visual and textual information.

data.source: Japanese documents collected from open-access sources including governmental and public documents.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by 43 annotators, including multiple question categories and unanswerable questions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on exact matches for Yes/No, factoid, and numerical questions, and BLEU Score for open-ended questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better question-answering performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are reported for multiple models including StableLM and OpenAI GPT series.
methodology.validation: Models are evaluated on distinct validation and test sets including those with and without unanswerable questions.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential harm through hallucination generation in language models.
